review: I am amazed by this product. It's a perfect package. So easy to install. Cast to your device from any device, including chrome browser on a pc, and apps on your iphone. You can cast the browser session onto the device, which is nice. However the animation has a delay. So playing videos isn't the best experience. However for apps like netflix, you can open netflix on the chrome browser and cast the video to the device. There are many apps now that can be cast to your device which is really nice. With chromecast, you don't need to keep the video playing or the app on the foreground on your control device. I have a samsung smart tv and I have been frustrated with how difficult it has been to use the apps on the smarthub. For example netflix keeps deactivating and netflix customer support said that they are actively working with samsung to resolve this issue and they haven't fixed it for an year now. Installing other apps on samsung smarthub is also cumbersome and time consuming. Opening smarthub takes 30 seconds each time and opening netflix app takes another 30 seconds. Now with chromecast, I am never using smarthub again. With Chromecast, I can cast video and music from apps like netflix, pandora, hulu and songza. Some of the apps allow you do cast videos on your iphone to your device. Some people here have written reviews that they couldn't cast videos on the device to chromecast. But there are apps to do that. Overall I love the product and hope for more cool apps that support chromecast.
author: Rajesh Konda

review: My dad has been watching Netflix on his Bluray Player for a few months, but he loves watching HBO, so this device was the perfect Christmas present. Using his phone (Galaxy Note 2), he can effortlessly stream episodes of Curb Your Enthusiasm straight to the TV. Set up required basic laptop profiency (which I handled) and took about 3 minutes.Once the chromecast has been set up, streaming content is very easy on android. The button that allows for streaming to the chromecast automatically pops up when playing videos in compatible apps (HBO Go, Netflix, Youtube, etc.). Pretty effortless and minimal learning curve. Google did a great job on this one
